engExample: I am going to school now.
I will go to the city tomorrow.
I come to the house daily.
I am coming to the shop now.
I am seeing a bird now.
I am speaking to a friend.
I am buying a book now.
I am taking a pen now.
I am living in the village now.
I will live in a house.
I am going to the market now.
I will go to the city.
I am having a pen now.
I am thinking about the sea.
I will think about the city.
I am saying a story now.
I am walking in the park now.
The book is on the table.
The cat is under the table.
What is your name? I’m Anil.
Where is the market? I need vegetables.
How much is this? It’s nice.
Where is the bathroom? I need it.
Can you help me? I’m lost.
malExample: നിനക്ക് എന്നെ സഹായിക്കാൻ കഴിയുമോ? ഞാൻ നഷ്ടപ്പെട്ടു.

engExample: See you later at the shop.
Where are you going? To the city?
I’m lost, where is the road?
Let’s eat sadya on banana leaf.
Welcome to Kerala, enjoy the backwaters!
Let’s have tea in the evening.
I love Kerala, it’s God’s own country.
malExample: എനിക്ക് കേരളം ഇഷ്ടമാണ്, ദൈവത്തിന്റെ സ്വന്തം നാട്.

engExample: Let’s go to the beach at Kovalam.
Let’s buy spices from the market.
I like banana chips with tea.
Let’s try sadhya at a restaurant.
I love the tea gardens in Munnar.
I had a strange dream last night.
The narrow path leads to forest.
We arrived at the airport early.
He went to the hospital yesterday.
He goes to the gym daily.
We watched a movie in cinema.
What do you mean by that?
I don't like it at all.
I want to buy this book.
Can I have the bill please?
I have a question for you.
How are things over there? All fine?
What are you doing now? Just sitting around?
Ate something or skipped? Don't starve.
Slept properly or stayed awake? Don't roam at night.

malExample: എല്ലാവരും ശരിയാണോ അവിടെ? ഒരു കുഴപ്പവും ഇല്ലല്ലേ?
malExampleTranslit: ellaavarum shariyaano avide? oru kuzhappavum illalle?

engExample: Took the medicine or skipped? Don't miss it.

english: Going out today or staying in?
engExample: Going out today or staying in? Lazy fellow.
malExample: ഇന്ന് പുറത്ത് പോകുന്നോ? അതോ ഇരിക്കുവാണോ മടിയനേ?
malExampleTranslit: innu puratthu pokunno? atho irikkuvaano madiyane?

engExample: Shall I call tomorrow? Or this evening?
Alright, talk later. Take it easy.
All good there or trouble? Tell me straight.
malExample: അവിടെ എല്ലാം ശരിയാണോ? കുഴപ്പം ഉണ്ടോ പറ.
malExampleTranslit: avide ellaam shariyaano? kuzhappam undo para.

engExample: What did you eat today? Had a decent meal?
malExample: ഇന്ന് എന്താ കഴിച്ചത്? ശരിയായ ഭക്ഷണം കഴിച്ചോ?
malExampleTranslit: innu enthaa kazhichathu? shariyaaya bhakshanam kazhichcho?

english: Are the kids studying or playing?
engExample: Are the kids studying or playing? Tell the truth.
malExample: കുട്ടികൾ പഠിക്കുന്നുണ്ടോ? അതോ കളിച്ചു നടക്കുവാണോ? സത്യം പറ.
malExampleTranslit: kuttikal padikkunnundo? atho kalichu nadakkuvaano? sathyam para.

english: Went for a walk or skipped?
engExample: Went for a walk or skipped? Lazy as usual.
Voice sounds alright today? Not rough?
Don't overdo anything. Take it easy.
Need anything just tell me. I'm here.

english: Rested in the afternoon or skipped?
engExample: Rested in the afternoon or skipped? Lazy fellow.
Anyone called you today? Or quiet?
Don't worry too much. It'll be fine.
I'll call later. Stay near the phone.
Look after yourself. Don't be careless.
Drank water or not? Drink some.
How is the heat there? Too much?
Feeling weak or what? Eat something.
Watched anything or not? Any programme?
Don't stay alone too much. Talk to someone.
Missing you all. When are we meeting?
malExample: നിങ്ങളെ മിസ്സ് ചെയ്യുന്നു. എപ്പോഴാ കാണാൻ പോകുന്നത്?
malExampleTranslit: ningale miss cheyyunnu. eppozhaa kaanaan pokunnathu?

engExample: Sleep early. Don't stay up late.
Appetite okay or not? Eating enough?
I'll call in the evening. Stay ready.
How is the hunger? Ate enough?
Don't sit too long. Move around.
I'll call back soon. Stay near the phone.
malExample: ഉടൻ തിരിച്ചു വിളിക്കാം. ഫോൺ അടുത്ത് ഇരിക്ക്.
malExampleTranslit: udan thirichu vilikkaam. phone adutthu irikku.

engExample: How is the head? Pain or not?
Don't forget to smile. Be happy.

Don't think too much. It'll be fine.
